UI.welcomeText: Découvrez la Bible d'une Nouvelle Façon
UI.homeSubtitle: Commencez votre aventure biblique en choisissant un plan de lecture ou un défi qui correspond à vos objectifs.
UI.beginJourney: Commencez votre voyage de lecture avec la Genèse
UI.emojiPageSubtitle: Utilisez des émojis pour marquer votre réaction émotionnelle aux différents passages de la Bible

Questions.Q000-S1-Q1: What did Jesus instruct His disciples to do?
Questions.Q000-S1-Q2: What did Jesus say about how the disciples will be treated?
Questions.Q000-S1-Q3: How do you think the disciples felt about Jesus' instructions?
Questions.Q000-S1-Q4: In what ways do Jesus' instructions apply to you?
Questions.Q000-S10-Q1: What is the example of the Macedonian church that Paul shares with the Corinthians?
Questions.Q000-S10-Q2: What is Paul's expectation of the Corinthians?
Questions.Q000-S10-Q3: What can you learn about generosity from Paul's teaching?
Questions.Q000-S10-Q4: In light of what you've learned, ask God to guide you to give generously this week to someone in need.
Questions.Q000-S11-Q1: Why is Paul writing to Philemon?
Questions.Q000-S11-Q2: Who was Onesimus and how did Paul meet him?
Questions.Q000-S11-Q3: How did Paul expect the gospel to reshape the relationship between Philemon and Onesimus?
Questions.Q000-S11-Q4: Are there accepted relationships in your culture that the gospel would reshape? What would that look like?
Questions.Q000-S12-Q1: About whom does John issue a warning?
Questions.Q000-S12-Q2: How does John encourage the church to guard against deception?
Questions.Q000-S12-Q3: Are there people that you should not be listening to?
Questions.Q000-S12-Q4: How can you abide in the teaching of Christ?
Questions.Q000-S13-Q1: Whom does John say we should welcome in our midst?
Questions.Q000-S13-Q2: How does John encourage the church to support ministers of the gospel?
Questions.Q000-S13-Q3: Are there people that you should be listening to?
Questions.Q000-S13-Q4: How can you promote the teaching of Christ?
Questions.Q000-S2-Q1: What does Jesus teach about forgiveness?
Questions.Q000-S2-Q2: According to this passage how should we go about restoring broken relationships?
Questions.Q000-S2-Q3: Is there someone whom you have wronged and you need to ask forgiveness from? Make specific plans to do that.
Questions.Q000-S2-Q4: Is there someone you need to forgive in your life? Talk to God about it.
Questions.Q000-S3-Q1: Imagine yourself in the story, observing first hand the crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus. With which character do you most identify? Why?
Questions.Q000-S3-Q2: Note the different individual and groups that encountered the risen Jesus. How did each respond?
Questions.Q000-S3-Q3: When Jesus appeared to his disciples what did he do and say to them?
Questions.Q000-S3-Q4: How has Jesus' final command made a difference in your life? How should it?
Questions.Q000-S4-Q1: Note the different ways people responded to Jesus as he journeyed to Jerusalem.
Questions.Q000-S4-Q2: Do you identify with one of those responses? If so, how?
Questions.Q000-S4-Q3: According to Jesus, who is one's "neighbor" and what does loving them look like?
Questions.Q000-S4-Q4: The disciples asked Jesus to teach them to pray. What can you learn from Jesus' response?
Questions.Q000-S5-Q1: What were the two signs Jesus performed in this story?
Questions.Q000-S5-Q2: Jesus' acts and his words are linked together. How do his words help you understand the signs better?
Questions.Q000-S5-Q3: What most amazes you about Jesus in this story?
Questions.Q000-S5-Q4: How do people respond to Jesus' signs and teaching? How will you respond to Jesus' signs and teaching?
Questions.Q000-S6-Q1: What can you learn from Jesus about how he faced suffering and injustice?
Questions.Q000-S6-Q2: What did Peter say when he was asked if he was one of Jesus' disciples? Why do you think he answered this way?
Questions.Q000-S6-Q3: Imagine how Peter felt in this story? When have you felt similar emotions? How did you respond?
Questions.Q000-S6-Q4: Spend some time talking to God about your personal experiences regarding suffering, injustice and denial. Allow God to lead you to an appropriate response.
Questions.Q000-S7-Q1: What issue did the apostles and elders gather in Jerusalem to consider?
Questions.Q000-S7-Q2: According to Peter in this story how are believers saved?
Questions.Q000-S7-Q3: Do you feel the need to fulfill certain religious expectations to be saved?
Questions.Q000-S7-Q4: Just as the Holy Spirit confirmed the truth of the gospel to apostles and elders, what is the Holy Spirit saying to you?
Questions.Q000-S8-Q1: Paul gives his testimony twice in this passage. How does he describe his life before meeting Jesus?
Questions.Q000-S8-Q2: How does Paul describe his encounter with Jesus?
Questions.Q000-S8-Q3: How does Paul describe his life as a follower of Jesus?
Questions.Q000-S8-Q4: Write your own story, including these three elements: your life before Jesus, your encounter with Jesus, and your life as a follower of Jesus. Make a plan to share your story with someone this week.
Questions.Q000-S9-Q1: What is Paul's stated ambition? How is it like your ambitions? How is it different?
Questions.Q000-S9-Q2: Consider all the individuals Paul greets. What does this tell about how much he valued people and relationships?
Questions.Q000-S9-Q3: What inspired Paul to make travel plans?
Questions.Q000-S9-Q4: When you consider the future how much do kingdom goals shape your plans? Are there changes this passage would inspire you to make?
Questions.Q001-S0-Q1: What is your favorite part of this story?
Questions.Q001-S0-Q2: What do you learn about God?
Questions.Q001-S0-Q3: What do you learn about human beings?
Questions.Q001-S0-Q4: What action are you inspired to make in light of what you have read?
Questions.Q001-S1-Q1: What stands out to you in this passage?
Questions.Q001-S1-Q2: What truths do you gain about the character of God?
Questions.Q001-S1-Q3: What truths do you gain about men and women?
Questions.Q001-S1-Q4: What changes are you motivated to make in light of this passage?
Questions.Q001-S2-Q1: What do you like about this portion of Scripture?
Questions.Q001-S2-Q2: What do you observe about the ways of God?
Questions.Q001-S2-Q3: What do you observe about the key characters in this portion of Scripture?
Questions.Q001-S2-Q4: What response are you wanting to make in light of these observations?
Questions.Q002-S3-Q1: In this story is there an example that you should imitate? What is it?
Questions.Q002-S3-Q2: What steps can you take today to do this?
Questions.Q002-S3-Q3: In this story is there an example that you should avoid? What is it?
Questions.Q002-S3-Q4: What steps can you take today to do this?
Questions.Q002-S4-Q1: In this passage is there an action that you should follow? What is it?
Questions.Q002-S4-Q2: What decisions can you make this week to do this?
Questions.Q002-S4-Q3: In this passage is there an action from which you should repent? What is it?
Questions.Q002-S4-Q4: What decisions can you make this week to do this?
Questions.Q002-S5-Q1: Does this portion of Scripture address a character quality you should seek to cultivate? What is it?
Questions.Q002-S5-Q2: What actions can you embark on in your life to do this?
Questions.Q002-S5-Q3: Does this portion of Scripture address a character flaw you should seek to uproot? What is it?
Questions.Q002-S5-Q4: What actions can you embark on your life to do this?
Questions.Q003-S6-Q1: Take note of the acts of God described in this story.
Questions.Q003-S6-Q2: What do these reveal about the character of God?
Questions.Q003-S6-Q3: Have you experienced this dimension of the character of God in your life? If yes, how so? If not, how might you come to experience this?
Questions.Q003-S6-Q4: What can you do to grow in your desire to know and experience God more intimately today?
Questions.Q003-S7-Q1: Consider the acts of God described in this passage.
Questions.Q003-S7-Q2: What do these illustrate about the ways of God?
Questions.Q003-S7-Q3: Have you experienced these ways of God in your life? If yes, how so? If not, what can you do to experience this?
Questions.Q003-S7-Q4: What can you do to grow in your desire to know and follow God more intimately this week?
Questions.Q003-S8-Q1: Meditate on the acts of God described in this portion of Scripture.
Questions.Q003-S8-Q2: What do these clarify about the heart of God?
Questions.Q003-S8-Q3: Have you experienced this expression of the heart of God in your life? If yes, how so? If not, what steps can you take to experience this?
Questions.Q003-S8-Q4: What can you do to grow in your desire to know and obey God more intimately in your life?
Questions.Q004-S10-Q1: What God-given guidance can you observe in this passage?
Questions.Q004-S10-Q2: Put yourself in the passage and envision what it might have been like to receive this guidance. How does this relate to you and your family today?
Questions.Q004-S10-Q3: What God-inspired encouragement can you observe in this passage? How can you experience more of this in your own life?
Questions.Q004-S10-Q4: Write a poem about what this encouragement means for you.
Questions.Q004-S11-Q1: What God-given instructions do you note in this portion of Scripture?
Questions.Q004-S11-Q2: Put yourself in the original setting and creatively think about what it might have been like to receive this instruction. How does this relate to you where you live and work today?
Questions.Q004-S11-Q3: What God-inspired hope do you note in this portion of Scripture? How can you grow to have more of this in your own life?
Questions.Q004-S11-Q4: Commit yourself to tell a friend about what this hope means for you today.
Questions.Q004-S9-Q1: What God-given commands can you discover in this story?
Questions.Q004-S9-Q2: Put yourself in the story and imagine what it originally might have been like to receive this command. How does this relate to you in your personal life today?
Questions.Q004-S9-Q3: What God-inspired promises can you discover in this story? How can you walk in more of this in your own life?
Questions.Q004-S9-Q4: Draw a picture about what these promises mean for you.
Questions.Q005-S12-Q1: With which character do you most identify in this story? Why?
Questions.Q005-S12-Q2: What strengths and/or weaknesses do you see in this character?
Questions.Q005-S12-Q3: What do you think God was wanting your selected character to learn?
Questions.Q005-S12-Q4: What do you think God is wanting you to learn through this story? How can you cooperate with his good purposes today?
Questions.Q005-S13-Q1: With which character do you most identify in this passage? Why?
Questions.Q005-S13-Q2: What strengths and/or weaknesses do you see in this character in this passage?
Questions.Q005-S13-Q3: What do you think God was wanting do in the life of your selected character?
Questions.Q005-S13-Q4: What do you think God is wanting to do in your life as you reflect on this passage? How can you cooperate with his loving purposes this week?
Questions.Q005-S14-Q1: With which character do you most identify in this portion of Scripture? Why?
Questions.Q005-S14-Q2: What strengths and/or weaknesses do you see in this character in this portion of Scripture?
Questions.Q005-S14-Q3: What do you think God was wanting accomplish through the life of your selected character?
Questions.Q005-S14-Q4: What do you think God is wanting to accomplish through your life? How can you cooperate with his kind purposes in your life?
Questions.Q006-S15-Q1: To compare is to associate two or more similar persons, ideas, or situations. Can you discover any comparisons made by the author of this story? What are they?
Questions.Q006-S15-Q2: What do you think the author was wanting to stress through this comparison?
Questions.Q006-S15-Q3: What parallels do you see between this Biblical story and your life?
Questions.Q006-S15-Q4: Please take time to write a short prayer to God responding to what you have discovered through these comparisons.
Questions.Q006-S16-Q1: To compare is to associate two or more similar persons, ideas, or situations. Can you see any comparisons made by the author of this passage? What are they?
Questions.Q006-S16-Q2: What do you think the author was wanting the original hearers to learn through this comparison?
Questions.Q006-S16-Q3: What can you learn from this passage that is applicable to you?
Questions.Q006-S16-Q4: Please take time to tell a friend what God is teaching you through this reflection on the Bible.
Questions.Q006-S17-Q1: To compare is to associate two or more similar persons, ideas, or situations. Can you describe any comparisons made by the author of this portion of Scripture? What are they?
Questions.Q006-S17-Q2: What do you think is the purpose of the Holy Spirit in highlighting this comparison?
Questions.Q006-S17-Q3: What is the Holy Spirit saying to you now?
Questions.Q006-S17-Q4: Please take time to post on your social media what you have learned through this passage.
Questions.Q007-S18-Q1: Take time to note any repeated words or concepts you have found in this story.
Questions.Q007-S18-Q2: Why do you think the author felt it was necessary to emphasize these words or concepts?
Questions.Q007-S18-Q3: What lessons do you learn from this repetition?
Questions.Q007-S18-Q4: How can this re-occuring theme have application in your life this day?
Questions.Q007-S19-Q1: Take time to note any repeated words or concepts you have noted in this passage.
Questions.Q007-S19-Q2: Why do you think the author felt it was important to emphasize these words or concepts?
Questions.Q007-S19-Q3: What principles are made clear by this repetition?
Questions.Q007-S19-Q4: How can this re-occuring theme have application in your life this week?
Questions.Q007-S20-Q1: Take time to note any repeated words or concepts you have observed in this portion of Scripture.
Questions.Q007-S20-Q2: Why do you think the author felt it was crucial to emphasize these words or concepts?
Questions.Q007-S20-Q3: What insights can be gleaned from the author's use of this repetition?
Questions.Q007-S20-Q4: How can this re-occuring theme have application in this season of your life?
Questions.Q008-S21-Q1: To contrast is to put side by side two or more distinct persons, ideas, or situations. Can you discover any contrasts made by the author of this story? What are they?
Questions.Q008-S21-Q2: What do you think the author was wanting to stress through this contrast?
Questions.Q008-S21-Q3: What parallels do you see between this Biblical story and your life?
Questions.Q008-S21-Q4: Please take time to write a short prayer to God responding to what you have discovered through these contrasts
Questions.Q008-S22-Q1: To contrast is to put side by side two or more distinct persons, ideas, or situations. Can you see, describe any contrasts made by the author of this passage? What are they?
Questions.Q008-S22-Q2: What do you think the author was wanting the original hearers to learn through this contrast?
Questions.Q008-S22-Q3: What can you learn from this passage that is applicable to you?
Questions.Q008-S22-Q4: Please take time to tell a friend what God is teaching you through this reflection on the Bible.
Questions.Q008-S23-Q1: To contrast is to put side by side two or more distinct persons, ideas, or situations. Can you describe any contrasts made by the author of this story portion of Scripture? What are they?
Questions.Q008-S23-Q2: What do you think is the purpose of the Holy Spirit in highlighting this contrast?
Questions.Q008-S23-Q3: What is the Holy Spirit saying to you now?
Questions.Q008-S23-Q4: Please take time to post on your social media what you have learned through this passage.
Questions.Q009-S24-Q1: List all the questions raised in the text. Who makes them? To whom are they made?
Questions.Q009-S24-Q2: Is there a question that stands out to you? Why?
Questions.Q009-S24-Q3: What questions would you like to be able to ask the author of this text?
Questions.Q009-S24-Q4: What implications do these questions from the text have for your life?
Questions.Q009-S25-Q1: List all the many questions raised in this passage. Who makes them? To whom are they made?
Questions.Q009-S25-Q2: Is there a question that impacts you more than others? Why?
Questions.Q009-S25-Q3: What questions would you have about issues raised in this passage?
Questions.Q009-S25-Q4: What can you do to get some answers to these questions you have raised?
Questions.Q009-S26-Q1: List the various questions raised in this portion of Scripture. Who makes them? To whom are they made?
Questions.Q009-S26-Q2: Have you ever asked any questions like these? When? To whom?
Questions.Q009-S26-Q3: Does this portion of Scripture raise any fresh questions in your own heart and mind? What are they?
Questions.Q009-S26-Q4: Write a trusted mentor with a question you may have about this portion of Scripture.
Questions.Q010-S27-Q1: We get to know the character of people by observing their actions. Who did what in this story? What do you learn about their character?
Questions.Q010-S27-Q2: Pick a person in this story with whom you identify. What can you learn from their life?
Questions.Q010-S27-Q3: Did God act in this story? If so, what attributes of God's character are revealed through His actions?
Questions.Q010-S27-Q4: What actions does this story inspire you to take? How will that grow godly character in your life?
Questions.Q010-S28-Q1: What we do says much about who we are. Identify the words in this passages that describe the actions of God and others.
Questions.Q010-S28-Q2: How would you describe the character of those people mentioned in this portion of Scripture?
Questions.Q010-S28-Q3: How would you describe the character of God given what is mentioned of his actions in this portion of Scripture?
Questions.Q010-S28-Q4: As you consider the actions of God and others in this portion of Scripture, what do you learn about yourself? What action steps should you take now?
Questions.Q010-S29-Q1: Our actions reveal our character. What do you learn about the character of the persons mentioned in this portion of Scripture as you observe what is said about their actions?
Questions.Q010-S29-Q2: Take some time to discuss the actions (verbs) of God you identified with your group and be attentive to what He wants to reveal about His character.
Questions.Q010-S29-Q3: Did God act in this story? If so, what attributes of God's character are revealed through His actions?
Questions.Q010-S29-Q4: What action steps should you take in your life today? How will this grow godliness in your life?
Questions.Q011-S30-Q1: How would you summarize this story? What are some of the main themes mentioned?
Questions.Q011-S30-Q2: Why do you think the author is writing about these main themes?
Questions.Q011-S30-Q3: How do you think knowing this would have impacted the original readers?
Questions.Q011-S30-Q4: How could this impact you, your family, your workplace, your church or society today? What immediate action(s) can you take?
Questions.Q011-S31-Q1: How would you summarize this passage? What main themes or topics is the author addressing?
Questions.Q011-S31-Q2: Why do you think the author is writing about these main themes?
Questions.Q011-S31-Q3: What do you think the author was trying to affirm or correct in the life of his audience?
Questions.Q011-S31-Q4: Is there something that you think God would like to affirm or see changed in your life? Take time to affirm someone in your reading group!
Questions.Q011-S32-Q1: How would you summarize this portion of Scripture? What main themes or topics do you observe?
Questions.Q011-S32-Q2: Why do you think the author is writing about these main themes?
Questions.Q011-S32-Q3: What do you think God was trying to affirm or correct in the life of the original hearers of this passage?
Questions.Q011-S32-Q4: What do you think God is trying to affirm or correct in your life?
